author: Miguel Barrera
title: WorldWide ADA/local fiat possible
description: Cardano should be worthy of baking the unbank but people in several countries of the world CAN'T use their own fiat to buy ADA yet

assessments.note: The problem identified is significant, however the proposal doesn't connect with the challenge's goals. The proposal doesn't demonstrate how the solution will lead to more proposals on ideascale, and it wouldn't deliver value to idea scale within the stated timeline.

This doesn't really help bring outside entrepreneurs into the Cardano ecosystem. Also, if one cannot use her local currency to buy ADA directly from e.g. Binance, they can always use services such as https://localbitcoins.com/ to first buy BTC and then whichever other crypto.

The proposer is seeking to increase adoption by allowing more people onboard into Cardano with their fiat. This does not satisfy the category challenge this proposal was submitted in and will not attract proposers in the next 2 funds.

The basic idea of the proposal is to make ADA accessible to more/all fiat currencies. This is not part of this challenge which aimed at bringing more entrepreneurs to Catalyst. The funds would be used to further develop the idea, which means that there is still no plan for implementation.

The problem statement states that ADA is unaccessible for people. Yet anyone, anywhere can buy ADA electronically on various exchanges by converting local currencies on such an exchange. A simple smartphone suffices to perform this action.
So what this proposal concludes is just the creation of another exchange. Which raises the question; Should we really create a new exchange from the ground up when there are multiple initiatives of integrating with existing ones?

I think this proposal is very well defined step forward towards establishing connections across those areas of the unbanked and to further develop bridges needed to establish exchanges that help the institutions but also the users on these jurisdictions. Another think to consider is if this hasnt already been scoped by Cardano member at IOG as there are plans in place for that area and also if the need for local exchanges would be required if in the region exchanges, market place and loans are all carried out in the network. If local exchanges are required and havent been explored by African deals in the areas Cardano is working on then this proposal will be of utmost value to the community goals.

You have a big proposal/idea and it is good that you do a first round catalyst in order to assess the situation clearly. However i cannot judge this idea more for one main reason: there is a lack of definition of the terms. For a project with such a big scope, you should really develop more the idea.  The main problem is see with your idea from the start is the legal one, how are you going to tackle this or in which direction are you considering exploring ?
This is a very large task, with only one person behind it and a small amount of funding it is unlikely to deliver more proposers to ideascale.
Anyone can fork a DEX but starting a centralized exchange or peer-to-peer exchange takes a lot of effort. I don't see a team here who would be able to make it happen.

The proposer claims to have a CS degree as well as Marketing experience, given this skill set they should be able to partner up with other proposer who share their vision and bring their own idea to life working with a team.

The proposer provides a plan to further conceptualize his idea (e.g. interviews). But there is no plan to encourage entrepreneurs to join and get engaged on Catalyst (which is the goal of this challenge).

As stated above, I see no user base for such a platform as there are integration possibilities with existing ones.
There is no viable way to pay for platform development and the installation of a legal entity with just 3000 USD.
I highly doubt that there is a demand from the community for something like this.
It is highly likely with the experience and passion that the plan set out and the metrics can be deployed by the proposer.

Sadly, here i cannot give you more than 1 star. The main reason behind it is there is no metric to evaluate the whole thing. Moreover, when you state "knowledgeable people in the Cardano community" who are you referring to ? How do you plan on reaching out to them. Finally, you are aware of the ammount of work needed but you need to add more granularity to it. I can only assess a project if there are details on how to achieve the idea and the metrics used in order to measure if success is attained or not. So far you have the problem statement explained but that's it.
Unclear what the 3,000 USD would be used for.
The proposal is lacking information of timeline and budget breakdown to achieve their minimum desirable result.

There is no detailed roadmap, the proposer only explains, what he wants to do or what needs to be done. But there is no time frame given. As I said, this proposal does not address this challenge. My advice to the proposer is to finish his conceptualization before asking for funding in the future. Here is just a basic idea (which I think is a good one). But for a funding you should provide more specific details on how you will achieve the objectives of the challenge.

The 'detailed plan' is just a prolonged elaboration of the problem statement, trying to justify this proposal.
It does not provide a decent roadmap, information on implementation and lacks important information as to who would host this exchanging platform and what potential risks include.
There is sufficient data, metrics and roadmap well detailed and very clearly defined goals and experience deployed in its approach.

I gave you 2 stars on this because you are only asking to do research in order to have, in another round of funds, a more finely tuned proposal. However, even with this draft you need to provide more information like what is the time period you are looking into ? Give us also a narrower understanding of the term you used here "Several ideas must be validated in this project:
1.- Having a marketplace of ADA focused exchanges
2.-Having a separate legal entity that helps (technically or legally) the formation of ADA/fiat exchanges in each country.
3.- Generate an Open Source SW to support future ADA/Fiat exchanges." Finally, how will the fund requested be spent ? Are they to developp the legal entity or ask an already existing legal entity to review the project ? Or anything else ?

solution: Defining, in coordination with Cardano, a decentralized platform (not only tech) that helps entrepreneurs to create ADA/local fiat exchanges
experience: I'm a CS Engineer and also I have a diploma in Biz Management. 20+ yrs of experience as a PM, Biz Analyst, Consultant in many Multinationals
